verses.roman:
sei ta' bhūtera kathā kahana nā yāya
ojhā-ṭhāñi yāichoṅ,--yadi se bhūta chāḍāya

synonyms: sei—that; ta'-certainly; bhūtera—of the ghost; kathā—topics; kahana—to speak; nā yāya—is not possible; ojhā-ṭhāñi—to the exorcist; yāichoṅ—I am going; yadi—if; se—that; bhūta—the ghost; chāḍāya—he can cause to leave.
translation: "The ghost is certainly very difficult to talk about, but I am going to find an exorcist and ask him if he can release me from it.
